hatSitzungsverlauf: This property relates a parliamentary session to its course.
hatTagesordnungspunkt: This property relates the course of a parliamentary session to an agenda item that it contains.
Tagesordnungspunkt: Agenda item during the course of a parliamentary session. Contains speeches.
hatRede: This property relates an agenda item to a speech that is being made as part of it.
hatGeschlecht: Gender of a speaker. The only allowed values are 'm√§nnlich' for male and 'weiblich' for female.
hatFraktion: This property relates a speaker to the political party or parliamentary group he or she belongs to.
hatName_kurz: The string literal of the short name of a political party or parliamentary group.
hatOrdnungsruf: The presence of this statement, irrespective of its literal value, implies that a call to order was issued in the given speech.
hatDatum: Date on which a speech was made
Kommentar: Comment on a speech, which can include applause or laughter by parts of the audience
hatAbgeordnete_von: This property relates a comment to a political party or parliamentary group it was made by (an instance of pd:Fraktion) and indicates that the comment was made by parts of the party/group.
hatFraktion_ganz: This property relates a comment to a political party or parliamentary group it was made by (an instance of pd:Fraktion) and indicates that the comment was made by the party/group as a whole.
hatBeifall: The presence of this statement, irrespective of its literal value, implies applause, thereby signifying agreement with the speaker making the speech on which the comment is being made.
hatTop-id: Identifier of an agenda item for reference. This is typically a number and does not itself contain topic or content discussed.
hatWahlperiode: Electoral period or legislative period that a parliamentary session belongs to.
hatSitzung-nr: Session number, i.e. the number assigned to a parliamentary session.
hatOrdnungsruf_erteilt_an: This property relates a speech or an agenda item to a speaker (any member of parliament), implying that a call to order was issued to the given person during the given speech or agenda item.
